measured_by: drift rate (v) in the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The Methods section explains that “drift rate, denoted as v, reflects the speed or efficiency of evidence accumulation in reaching either of the two decision boundaries.”

measured_by: starting point parameter (z) in the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The paper clarifies that “Starting point bias, denoted as z, reflects the initial amount of bias in favour of one option.”

measured_by: boundary separation (a) in the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: It is described that “Boundary separation, denoted as a, reflects the distance or discriminability between the two subjective decision boundaries.”
